content.p: The proof of coverage documented with a Licensed Rating Organization is evidence that coverage is in effect until superseded or terminated.
The filing of Form WC-11 is evidence that coverage is in effect until superseded or terminated.
The filing of a cancellation by a group self-insurer fund on Form WC-11 is evidence that coverage is terminated, effective not less than 15 days after filing.
If the insured member employer operates under different trade names or d/b/a ("doing business as" name), a separate Form WC-11 must be filed for each trade name, properly cross-referenced.
Group self-insurance funds shall file a separate Form WC-11 for each insured member of the fund.

The revision effective July 1, 2009, inserted "or d/b/a ('doing business as' name)" in paragraph (b)(3), deleted "by July 1, 1987" at the end of paragraph (b)(4), and deleted "addressed to the Director of Licensure and Quality Assurance" preceding "when they add" in subsection (c).
